body: After triaging this with @bridgetkromhout, it looks like the behaviour seems in line with Kubernetes' expected behaviour. It's unclear for the reasoning behind the ServiceAccount being created after the Secret. I think it should be safe to re-arrange the install/uninstall order to create the ServiceAccount first. I think it may be worthwhile to do a bit of digging first to see if there was a reason that the resources were to be created in that particular order. Would you be willing to look further into this? Thanks!

@bacongobbler I did a quick research. The order Secret vs. ServiceAccount in the current helm source originates in https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/1238 discussed in https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/1228. 

https://github.com/helm/helm-classic/blob/master/action/install.go#L18 was mentioned as source for the proposed order. The order was refactored in https://github.com/helm/helm-classic/pull/271 but service accounts were originally added to the sort order in https://github.com/helm/helm-classic/pull/244, discussed in https://github.com/helm/helm-classic/issues/237. I did not find any evidence on why this specific order was chosen. It seems there was no discussion about the order at the time.

issue.title: helm rollback unsuccessful with service account
issue.body:
**Description:**
We had a helm chart installed which didn't have service account created.
We later did a helm upgrade of the chart with service account included.
When we did a helm rollback of the chart to original revision (which didn't have service account), pods are in crashLoopBackoff trying to mount the service account token which was deleted during rollback.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Install helm chart version 0.1.0 from attachment. This chart version doesn't have service account. Verify that pods are in running state.
2. Perform helm upgrade with chart version 0.1.4 from attachment. This chart version brings in service account "hello-world-sa". Verify that pods are in running state.
3. Perform a helm rollback to previous version. 
After step 3, the new pod created goes to crashLoopBackoff state with error "**FailedMount  111s (x70 over 128m)  kubelet, minikube  MountVolume.SetUp failed for volume "hello-world-sa-token-htdxc" : secret "hello-world-sa-token-xxxxx" not found**
"


[helm_rollback_issue_with_sa.zip](https://github.com/helm/helm/files/3402685/helm_rollback_issue_with_sa.zip)



**Output of `helm version`:**
[root@e2ecr2 hello-world]# helm version
Client: &version.Version{SemVer:"v2.13.1", GitCommit:"618447cbf203d147601b4b9bd7f8c37a5d39fbb4", GitTreeState:"clean"}
Server: &version.Version{SemVer:"v2.13.1", GitCommit:"618447cbf203d147601b4b9bd7f8c37a5d39fbb4", GitTreeState:"clean"}

**Output of `kubectl version`:**
[root@e2ecr2 hello-world]# kubectl version
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"14", GitVersion:"v1.14.1", GitCommit:"b7394102d6ef778017f2ca4046abbaa23b88c290", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-04-08T17:11:31Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.1", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"14", GitVersion:"v1.14.1", GitCommit:"b7394102d6ef778017f2ca4046abbaa23b88c290", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-04-08T17:02:58Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.1", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}

Cloud Provider/Platform (AKS, GKE, Minikube etc.): 
Minikube

issue.title: fix(helm): move ServiceAccount before Secret in InstallOrder.

labels.name: size/S
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 10-29 lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
Service accounts must be installed before secrets when service account tokens (secrets) are be managed by Helm. Otherwise Kubernetes will delete any service account token right after creation, since there is no service account mounting the token (see https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/access-authn-authz/service-accounts-admin/#token-controller)

Closes #7159.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Strobusch <1847260+dastrobu@users.noreply.github.com>

body:
> After triaging this with @bridgetkromhout, it looks like the behaviour seems in line with Kubernetes' expected behaviour. It's unclear for the reasoning behind the ServiceAccount being created after the Secret. I think it should be safe to re-arrange the install/uninstall order to create the ServiceAccount first. I think it may be worthwhile to do a bit of digging first to see if there was a reason that the resources were to be created in that particular order. Would you be willing to look further into this? Thanks!

hiï¼Œ seems "fix(helm): move ServiceAccount before Secret in InstallOrder. " don't solve the issue of "https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/6036 helm rollback unsuccessful with service account", I'm using helm v3.6.0, Any help would be appreciated.
Had the same problem in helm version 3.5.3
